author: yokem55
content: The specific properties to be addressed here are non-custodial management of funds (this can be done with contract based deposit pools and 0x01 withdrawal creds that also point to a contract), and permissionless node operation. Getting blessed to operate a node by a dao does not meet that threshold. A protocol that just requires over-collateralization to run a node goes a long way here to prevent concentration of the network.

author: ethdreamer
content:
So I have a general question about where I should make a proposal but I need to give some background:

During amphora it was discussed that we would likely use the merge as an opportunity to break the policy that all event logs are stored permanently by full nodes.

Pruning logs implies the deposit contract logs will be pruned as well.

This is okay because once a deposit becomes finalized in the beacon chain, it will never need to be Merkle proofed on-chain again and it can be discarded. The deposit Merkle tree can be significantly compressed by discarding old deposits and transmitted to newly syncing nodes during weak subjectivity sync.

I've implemented this in lighthouse and Zahari has implemented it for Nimbus.

Now we want to write something up to explain how to implement this, and get the ball rolling on standardizing the data structure used to transmit the deposit tree, and standardize the beacon API endpoint to fetch the deposit tree.

My question is where do I write this? Does this need an EIP?
